dialogue.speaker: empty
text: On one seemingly normal day in the Literature Club… Natsuki demonstrates her fast singing skills to fellow club member Yuri.

dialogue.speaker: natsukiright
text: "Hah, this 'rapping' stuff that Boyfriend loves so much ain't hard at all! All that time singing in the mirror really did pay off."

dialogue.speaker: yurileft
text: "So fast, yet still so clear and rhythmic. I haven't seen anyone here be able to pull that off the way you do. I… I'd definitely get too overwhelmed and botch my words."

dialogue.speaker: natsukiright
text: "Hey, you're the one with the actually good singing voice, though. Faster doesn't always mean better sounding, y'know."

dialogue.speaker: yurileft
text: "-but the conviction required to pull off such intense lyrical feats! I'm not nearly at that level yet! I'm confined to the slower, more standard melodies."

dialogue.speaker: natsukiright
text: "And what's wrong with that? You make them sound perfect! I'll sound bad if I even try to sing in your deeper tones!"

dialogue.speaker: yurileft
text: "Th-that's not true! You'd be able to get it down so easy! You at least have the confidence to try!"

dialogue.speaker: natsukiright
text: "Geez, Yuri, just take the compliment already!"

dialogue.speaker: yurileft
text: "Putting yourself down is not a compliment-!"

dialogue.speaker: natsukiright
text: "You're literally doing the same thing!!! Rrragh-! Fine! I'll prove you wrong right now!"
